casebody.data:
BELLSOUTH TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.
v.
CITY OF LAURINBURG, a North Carolina Municipal Corporation, and School Link, Inc., a North Carolina Corporation. No. 118P05. Supreme Court of North Carolina. April 6, 2005. Edward S. Finley, Jr., Raleigh, Edward L. Rankin, III, Dorian S. Denburg, Atlanta, GA, John E. Muench, Robert M. Dow, Jr., Chicago, IL, for BellSouth Telecommunications. Michael Crowell, Raleigh, Charles L. Hicks, Jr., Laurinburg, for City of Laurinburg. Ronnie M. Mitchell, Coy E. Brewer, Jr., Fayetteville, for School Link, Inc. Karen K. Prather, M. Gray Styers, Jr., Warrenton, for Telecommunications Ind., et al. Wade H. Hargrove, Mark J. Prak, Marcus W. Trathen, Raleigh, for NC Cable Telecommunications. Prior report: ___ N.C.App. ___, 606 S.E.2d 721 .

ORDER

Upon consideration of the petition filed on the 22nd day of February 2005 by Plaintiff in this matter for discretionary review of the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals pursuant to G.S. 7A-31, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 6th day of April 2005."

Justice MARTIN recused.
